div.head: Common Music Notation Ornaments
div.p: This module includes elements and attributes for the encoding of ornaments typical of Common Music Notation (CMN). Ornaments are formulae of embellishment that can be realized by adding supplementary notes to one or more notes of the melody. In writte form, these are usually expressed as symbols written above or belove a note; though some other have a more complex written expression such as those that involve multiple notes and/or include grace notes to specify conluding turns or variations.

These symbols may have different resolutions depending on a large number of factors such as historical context, national boundaries, composer, scribe, etc. The elements here described, therefore, are not bound to a specific symbol; they are, instead, meant to encode the encoder's interpretation of a symbol and its position on the staff.
Nonetheless, in order to establish a common ground, the guidelines suggest commonly accepted realizations for each type of symbol.

Alternatively or additionally, the relationship with a note can be expressed in terms of beats with the attribute tstamp. For example, assuming that the following measure is in 2/2, the mordent would be related to the note on the first beat.
The following sections will introduce each element in detail for all types of ornaments supported.

div.head: Mordents
div.p: There are two common types of mordents: normal or lower mordent and inverted or uppermordent.

The type is specified with the attribute form, which accepts the following values: norm

The resultions suggested above are to be considered default. It is possible, however, to override these defaults by describing a different resolution in the header using encodingDesc. Alternatively, resolutions can be defined case-by-case by encoding a specific resolution within the element mordent.
